Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) with high energy -conversion efficiency and high fuel flexibility play crucial roles in the low -carbon hydrogen economy, being faced with two main difficulties of carbon deposition and sulfur poison in conventional Ni-based cermet anodes.
Titulo: Recent progress on efficient perovskite ceramic anodes for high-performing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Perovskite oxides stand out to be a new generation of high -performing anode materials due to their high mixed -ionic -electronic conductivity, efficient fuel -oxidation electrocatalytic activity, and growing carbon-coking/sulfur-poison resistance but still suffer from the structural and performing instability.
Titulo: Recent progress on efficient perovskite ceramic anodes for high-performing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In recent years, B -site doping is recognized as one of advanced strategies for achieving high -durability perovskite anodes of high -temperature SOFCs, which is rapidly developing.
Titulo: Recent progress on efficient perovskite ceramic anodes for high-performing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Here, we summary the effects of several common B -site doping elements (Cr, Sc, Ti, Nb, and Mo) on the performance of perovskite anodes, and review the B -site doping strategies for perovskite anodes of high -temperature SOFCs.
Titulo: Recent progress on efficient perovskite ceramic anodes for high-performing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A variety of elements are introduced to stabilize the perovskite structure in the fuel -cell operating environments after B -site doping, and the improvement and deficiency of these element doping on various aspects of anode performance are discussed.
Titulo: Recent progress on efficient perovskite ceramic anodes for high-performing solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: By symmetrically comparing the advantages and disadvantages of these element doping, we point out the developing directions of high -temperature fuel -cell perovskite anodes in the future.
Titulo: Recent progress on efficient perovskite ceramic anodes for high-performing solid oxide fuel cells
